Detailed Description

Abstract base class for all shader bricks.

DzShaderBricks encapsulate the creation of rsl shaders from the brick connection network seen in the shader mixer pane. Developers desiring to add new bricks should inherit this class and implement the virtual functions for their brick. The brick must also provide a class factory requiring no arguments.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Creates a new shader brick

DzDefaultInParam * DzShaderBrick::addDefaultInParameter ( int  type,
const QString &  argName,
const QString &  label,
const QString &  defaultVal 
) [slot]

convenience function or creating a DzDefaultInParam

Parameters:
type DzBrickParam::ParamType for this enum param
argName argument name for this param, must be unique in the brick
label label for this param
defaultValue a string holding the value of a RSL global variable
Returns:
a DzDefaultInParam that was added to this brick
Note:
all unconnected DzDefaultInParam 's are checked to to see what variables a brick needs in order to connect to another brick. The type must match exactly with the type of the global param or this check will fail

The following are the types provided by the various DzBrickSet::ShaderType 's:

None - provides no default parameters
DzBrickSet::Surface,
DzBrickSet::VolumeAtmosphere,
DzBrickSet::VolumeInterior,
DzBrickSet::VolumeExterior

bool DzShaderBrick::addParameter ( DzBrickParam *  param  )  [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
param param to add to this brick
Note:
it is generally better to use one of the convenience functions: DzShaderBrick::addFloatParameter,DzShaderBrick::addIntParameter,DzShaderBrick::addColorParameter, DzShaderBrick::addEnumPropertyParameter,DzShaderBrick::addBoolParameter, DzShaderBrick::addVec3Parameter,DzShaderBrick::addMatrixParameter,DzShaderBrick::addImageParameter, DzShaderBrick::addStringParameter,DzShaderBrick::addFileParameter,DzShaderBrick::addEnumParameter, DzShaderBrick::addDefaultInParameter, or DzShaderBrick::addOutParameter
Returns:
true if successful
void DzShaderBrick::addRequiredParam ( int  paramType,
const QString &  name 
) [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
paramType DzBrickParam::Type for the param
name Name of the required param
Note:
adding a required param to a brick in this way indicates that it should only be connected to networks that provide this param. In general it is better to do this with a DzDefaultInParam instead.
void DzShaderBrick::addScopedParam ( int  paramType,
const QString &  name,
int  scope = -1 
) [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
paramType DzBrickParam::ParamType for the param
name Name of the param, must be unqiue for the scope it represents
scope scope for the param. -1 indicates global(all children receive this scope param), 0 or higher indicates that children of params of this scope receive this param
Note:
this call does not actually create any RSL code, it simply indicates to bricks that being a child of this brick gives them an additional variable to do. It is the brick developers task to set up these variable in their RSL code.
See also:
DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall(),DzShaderBrick::getNumScopesNeeded()

void DzShaderBrick::getAttributes ( DzSettings *  settings  )  const [virtual, slot]
Note:
the following code: 
        DzSettings set;
        brickOfThisClass->getAttributes(&settings);
        anotherBrickOfThisClass->setAttributes(&settings);
settings to set this brick with

should end up with brickOfThisClass and anotherBrickOfThisClass being exactly the same.

QStringList DzShaderBrick::getBrickActionList (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
a QStringList of brick action strings. A brick action string is a string with the following format:
BrickActionClassName::Args
BrickActionClassName is a class with a class factory that inherits from DzBrickAction, the Args (without the leading ::) are handed to that class on successfully creation with the DzBrickAction::setArgs function.
Note:
if an empty string exists in the list, it is treated as a seperator
See also:
DzBrickAction
QString DzShaderBrick::getBrickClass (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
the brick class for this object. Defaults to the class name for this shader brick

Returns:
returns the class factory for the given class name or Null if it cannot find a class factory for the given class that creates a shader brick.

the global shader code for this brick class. This code needs to be globaly unique. This is a place to put functions called by bricks of this brick class. Returns NULL by default

int DzShaderBrick::getNumOfClassTokens (  )  const [virtual, slot]

DzShaderString * DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall ( const QStringList &  varCallNames,
const QStringList &  varArgNames,
int  scope 
) const [protected, virtual]
Parameters:
varCallNames the RSL equivalent for matching value in varArgNames
varArgNames the arg names return by DzBrickParam::getArg in corresponding position with the varCallNames
scope the current scope to write the code for
Returns:
the code for the given scope
See also:
DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall,DzShaderBrick::getNumScopesNeeded

The RSL from this is generated as follows: 

    //code from brick network connected to global params
    //code from DzShaderBrick::getShaderCodeCall
    //code from brick network connected to scope 0
    //code from DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall with scope 0
    //code from brick network connected to scope 1
    //code from DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall with scope 1
    ....
    //code from brick network connected to scope DzShaderBrick::getNumScopesNeeded - 1
    //code from DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall with scope DzShaderBrick::getNumScopesNeeded - 1
Note:
this call is complex to allow looping, and control blocks. In most cases implementing DzShaderBrick::getShaderCodeCall is sufficient.
DzShaderString * DzShaderBrick::getShaderCodeCall ( const QStringList &  varCallNames,
const QStringList &  varArgNames 
) const [protected, pure virtual]
Parameters:
varCallNames the RSL equivalent for matching value in varArgNames
varArgNames the arg names return by DzBrickParam::getArg in corresponding position with the varCallNames
Returns:
the RSL shader code for this brick.
QString DzShaderBrick::getVarName ( const QString &  argName,
const QStringList &  varCallNames,
const QStringList  varArgNames 
) const [slot] 
        DzShaderString* MyShaderBrick::getShaderCodeCall(const QStringList& varCallNames,const QStringList& varArgNames)const
        {
            QString myOutArgumentInRSL = getVarName("myOutArg",varCallNames,varArgNames);
            QString myInArgumentInRSL = getVarName("myInArg",varCallNames,varArgNames);
            QString code = QString("%1 = myRSLFunction(%2);").arg(myOutArgumentInRSL).arg(myOutArgumentInRSL);
            return new DzShaderString(code);
        }
Parameters:
argName argument name to get the RSL code for
varCallNames list of RSL representation for the matching the list of supplied varArgNames
varArgNames list of varArgNames This convenience function is designed to look up the needed RSL arguments from C++ arguments handed to getShaderCodeCall and getScopedShaderCodeCall.

bool DzShaderBrick::isScopedBrick (  )  [virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if this is a scoped brick. Returns false by default. Scoped bricks override and use DzShaderBrick::getScopedShaderCodeCall and DzShaderBrick::getNumScopesNeeded to create bricks that have multiple codes in their generated code

DzElement * DzShaderBrick::setAttributes ( const DzSettings *  settings  )  [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
settings the dzsetings to set this bricks attributes from. This is used for most copy/paste and apply actions on a brick. The base implementation handles properties on the brick. Parameter values are handled in different code unless DzShaderBrick::writesOwnParameters returns true (the default is false). If other settings are needed for this brick this should be overridden.
See also:
DzShaderBrick::writesOwnParameters,DzShaderBrick::getAttributes

void DzShaderBrick::setPointer ( const DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework when reading a native file. Derived classes should override this method if they ever write out pointer values to the data file. This method will be called with the sectionID and pointerID that were given when writing the file out. The passed pointer may be shared so should not be deleted.

Parameters:
file The file being loaded
sectionID The ID of the file section being read
pointerID The ID of the pointer being read.
ptr The pointer being read.

if true if local properties should seperated in a settings sections on the default DzBrickOptions frame. Returns true by default

bool DzShaderBrick::usesLocalShaderSpace (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
if a light type, if the light should be declared in local (object) space. Surfaces in DAZ Studio 3 are declared in local space in the render stream. Returns true by default
bool DzShaderBrick::writeConnectionsAsIndexes (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if the connections with this bricks params should be written as indexes instead of by arg name. False by default. This should only be overriden to return true if the brick cannot gaurentee unique names for all of its parameter's DzBrickParam::getArg calls.
bool DzShaderBrick::writesOwnParameters (  )  const [virtual, slot]
Returns:
true if this brick handles writing/reading its own brick param values in DzShaderBrick::setAttributes and DzShaderBrick::getAttributes. False by default
